name: BEST WESTERN Mar Menuda

reviews.text: We LOVED Tossa Del Mar. We would go back in a heartbeat. This town reminded us most of the almafi coast beach towns. The beach is beautiful and we enjoyed it so much more than the beach in Marbella. This is a LAID BACK, flip flops, casual, authentic spanish beach town. You will not see all the high end glitzy stores like in marbella or starbucks on every corner etc. and we loved that about this town. The beach chairs and beach umbrellas cost 20 euro a day for 3 adults. You do have to "rent" beach towels from the hotel. You may want to go into town and purchase some of these beach accessories. I am not sure if the sister hotel provides these extra touches. The hotel rooms need some work. We were 3 adults staying in a room that was very small. Our room overlooked the parking lot in the back of the hotel. The "newer" "sister hotel" Best Western looked a lot more modern! However, the town is so magical and amazing the room did not take away from our amazing time. The pool is a kiddie sized pool. The breakfast was good..you can ask the waitress for eggs cooked any style. The hotel staff was nice and very helpful . The LOCATION is awesome!! GO to Don Pepe's for GREAT guitar playing music and and awesome sangria. The bar is hopping and owners are awesome!
reviews.title: magical place, beautiful laid back casual town...hotel rooms need work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made our reservation at the Mar Menuda based on the review in Frommer's Spain. It wasn't expensive, so we ended up getting what we expected, but were slightly disappointed since Frommers can sometimes delight us by finding what we like.
reviews.title: Disappointed by Frommers Recommendation
Great Beach town with Spanish flavor
reviews.text: The hotel is old (1960s?) and doesn't appear to have had a major reno, just paint and maybe some new furniture. Pool was a joke - more of a large hot tub. Hot tub was murky and yellow - looked dangerous to soak in.
Hotel room needed some work. Broken sink in bathroom, and tiles missing on the terrace.
reviews.title: Great for a really relaxing break

reviews.text: Not all negative though. Staff were super freindly and helpful when we decided to stay in Tossa for another day. Managed to keep us in a ocean veiw room for 118 Euros and night. The room was smoking and had two doubles, (we wanted non-smoking and a queen or king bed) but that was our fault for changing our plans at the last moment.
reviews.title: Super location and value
Great place
reviews.text: Great location - friendly and very helpful staff

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, excellent location, right on beach, with it's own pool. Very clean hotel. Friendly staff. Very good buffet breakfast with Champagne! Only complaint: no mini-bar in room. Had to go to bar for cold drinks.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: I thought this hotel was excellent in it's price range. My room was spacious, clean and very pretty. The common areas were clean and attractive, and there was internet access in the lobby for a fee. I was pleased with the laundry service. You could walk right out of the hotel onto the beautiful beach. An ocean view room with a balcony would have been nice, if they are available.

reviews.title: Not that great!
reviews.text: What was Frommer's thinking? Our room was tiny with an even smaller bathroom. The air conditioning didn't work and the afternoon sun turned the small room into an oven, even with the windows open and the sea breeze. The hotel staff was distant at best and we (and other patrons) were refused service in the bar because they wanted to close early. The location is wonderful but the beach is definately NOT private.

aka: Best Western Mar Menuda Hotel Tossa De Mar
